alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 2:20PM EST until December 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches with the potential for over 6 inches mainly over northwest Warren County. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Warren County. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The periods of heaviest snowfall and travel impacts are expected between 8 PM Monday and 8 AM Tuesday as temperatures drop below freezing.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
